questions.question: Simplify: (2a² + 3a - 1) + (a² - 2a + 4)
questions.explanation: Combine like terms: a² terms: 2a² + a² = 3a²; a terms: 3a + (-2a) = a; constants: -1 + 4 = 3.

questions.question: What is (4x - 7) - (3x + 2)?
questions.explanation: Subtract: 4x - 3x = x, and -7 - 2 = -9. Important: subtracting 2 gives -9, not -5. So: x - 9.

questions.question: Add the expressions: (2m + n) + (3m - 2n)
questions.explanation: m terms: 2m + 3m = 5m; n terms: n + (-2n) = -n. Different variables stay separate: 5m - n.

questions.question: Simplify: (x² + 2x + 1) - (x² - 3x + 4)
questions.explanation: x² terms: x² - x² = 0; x terms: 2x - (-3x) = 2x + 3x = 5x; constants: 1 - 4 = -3. So: 5x - 3.

questions.question: What is the sum of (3p - 2q) and (p + 5q)?

questions: 'Subtract A from B' means B - A. So: (5x + y - 2) - (2x - 3y + 1) = 5x - 2x + y - (-3y) - 2 - 1 = 3x + 4y - 3.
The perimeter of a triangle with sides (x + 3), (2x - 1), and (3x + 2) is:
Perimeter = sum of all sides: (x + 3) + (2x - 1) + (3x + 2) = x + 2x + 3x + 3 - 1 + 2 = 6x + 4.
